Description:
Detects specific combinations of encoding methods in PowerShell via the commandline

Author: Teymur Kheirkhabarov (idea), Vasiliy Burov (rule), oscd.community, Tim Shelton
Sigma Repository: [GitHub](https://github.com/SigmaHQ/sigma)
Name: Potential Encoded PowerShell Patterns In CommandLine
Query: sourcetype='windows-sysmon' eql select * from _source_ where (((process_path like '%\powershell.exe' or process_path like '%\pwsh.exe') and (original_file_name = 'powershell.exe' or original_file_name = 'pwsh.dll')) and (((command like '%toint%' or command like '%todecimal%' or command like '%tobyte%' or command like '%touint%' or command like '%tosingle%' or command like '%tosbyte%') and (command like '%tochar%' or command like '%tostring%' or command like '%string%')) or ((command like '%split%' and command like '%join%') or (command like '%char%' and command like '%join%'))))
